page.title: 16Parish Councils
page.content: A form of local government has been in existence since the 8th. century. An important change was the grouping of parishes to administer the Poor Law. The next major change was the Local Government Act 1894, which included the creation of Parish Councils and the separation of the Church and the State for local government control. The present operation was introduced on 1st. April 1974 as a result of the 1972 Act. This Act gave the Parish Council the right to be notified of planning applications so that they can make recomendation to the District Council regarding these. The Poll for the election is every four years and the Parish Council can be regarded as an organ of local opinion.
